gurmukhi: Cky dyv Adyv jky gMDrb j`C br ]cky BUq Aru pRyq srb ibidAw Dr nr br ]
transliteration: Chhake Dev Adev Jake Gaddharab Jachchh Bar|| Chake Bhoot Ar(u) Pret Sarab Bidiaa Dhar Nar Bar||
translation: The gods, demons and Gandharvas all were filled with wonder and pleased; all ghosts, fiends and superb Vidyadharis wondered;

gurmukhi: KMkVIX kwl kRUrw pRBw bhu pRkwr ausqq krIX ]KMfn AKMf cMfI mhw jX jX jX sbdocrIX ]542]
transliteration: Khankdeeya Kaal Krooraa Prabhaa Bahu Prakaar Oustat Dareeya|| Khanndan Akhannddchanndimahaa Jaya Jaya Jaya Sabdo-achreeya||542||
translation: Kalki (Lord) thundered as a manifestation of KAL (death) and he was eulogized in various ways; the destroyer of invincible warriors like Chandika, the Lord Kalki was being hailed.542.

gurmukhi: iBVIX ByV lVKVIX myru JVpVI pqR bx ]fulIX ieMdR qVPV PinMd sukuVIX dRuvxgx ]
transliteration: Bhideeya Bher Ladkha Deeya Mer(u) Jhadpa Dipatra Ban|| Duliya Indra Tadphad Phanind Soukudeeya Druvanad||
translation: The armies fought with each other, the Sumeru mountain trembled, and the leaves of the forest quivered and fell; Indra and Sheshnaga writhed on becoming agitated;

gurmukhi: cikE gieMd DDkX cMd BMBijg idvwkwr ]fulg sumyr f`gg kumyr sB su`kg swier ]
transliteration: Chadio Gadnd Dhadhkaya Hand Bhanbhjig Divaakar||dula Soummer Daggad Koumer Samg Soukkag Saair||
translation: Ganas and others shrunk with fear; the elephants of he directions wondered; the moon was frightened and the sun ran hither and thither; the Sumeru mountain wavered; the Tortoise became unsteady and all the oceans dried up in fear;

gurmukhi: qMqjg iDAwn qb DUr jtI sih n Bwr s`kg iQrw ]au`Clg nIr p`Culg pvn su fg fg fg kMpgu Drw ]543]
transliteration: Tantjag Dhiaan Tab Dhoor Jatisah(i) Na Bhaar Sakkah Thiraa|| Ouchchhlag Neer Pachchhulag Pavan Su Dag Dag Dag Kanpag(u) Dharaa||543||
translation: The meditation of Shiva was shattered and the burden on the earth could not remain in equilibrium; the water sprang up, the wind flowed and the earth staggered and trembled.543.

gurmukhi: c`lg bwxu ruk`g idswx p`bX ipswn huA ]ifgG ibMd auC`lG isMD kMpk sun muin DUA ]
transliteration: Challag Baan(u) Roukagg Disaan Pabbaya Pisaan Hua|| Digadh Bind Ouchhcllagh Sindh Kanpak Soun Mounndi) Dhooa||
translation: With the discharge of arrows, the directions were covered and the mountains were pulverized; of war, the sage Dhruva trembled;

gurmukhi: bHm byd qj gieMdR ieMdRwsix q`jg ]jidn kRUr klkI vqwr kRu`Dq rx g`jg ]
transliteration: Brahm Bed Taj Bhaj Gadndra Indraasan(i) Tajjag|| Jadin Kroor Kalkivataar Kruddhat Ran Gadjag||
translation: Brahma abandoned the Vedas and ran away, the elephants fled and Indra also left his seat; the day on which the Kalki incarnation, thundered in rage in the battlefield;

gurmukhi: auCrMq DUr bwjn KurIX sB AkwS mg Cwie lIA ]jx rcIX lok kr kop hir ASt kws Ktu Drx kIA ]544]
transliteration: Ouchhrant Dhoor Baajan Khureeya Sabh Akaadh Mag Chhaad Leeya|| Jan Racheeya Lok Kar Kop Har(i) Asht Kaas Khat(u) Dharankeea||544||
translation: On that day, the dust of the hoofs of the horses, springing up, covered the whole of the sky; it seemed that in his rage the Lord had created the additional eight skies and six earths.544.

gurmukhi: ckq cwr ckÍY ckRq isr shMs SyS Px ]Dkq m`C mwvws Cof rx Bjg dÍx gx ]
transliteration: Chakat Chaar Chakrvai Chakrat Sit Sahans Shesh Phan|| Khakat Machchh Maavaas Chhodh Ran Bhajag Dravan Gad||
translation: On all the four sides, all including Sheshnaga are wondering; the heats of the fish also throbbed; the ganas and others ran away from the war-arena;

gurmukhi: BRmq kwk kuMflIA ig`D auDhU ly aufIX ]bmq jÍwl KMkwl lu`Q h`Qo nhI CutIX ]
transliteration: Bhramar Kaak Koundaleea Giddh Ough-hoo Le Udeeya|| Bamat Jvaal Khankaal Loutth Hattho Nahichhouteeya||
translation: The crows and vultures violently hovered over the corpses and Shiva, the manifestation of KAL (death), is shouting in the battlefield, without dropping the dead from his hands;

gurmukhi: tutMq top PutMq ijrh dsq rwg pKr qurIX ]B`jMq BIr ir`JMq mn inrK sUr hUrYN iPrIX ]545]
transliteration: Toutant Top Phoutant Jirah Dast Raag Pakhar Tureeya|| Bhajjant Bjeer Rijjhant Man Nirakh Soor Hoorain||545||
translation: The helmets are breaking, the armours are being torn and the armoured horses are also getting frightened the cowards are running away and the warriors seeing the heavenly damsels are getting allured by them.545.

gurmukhi: jb kopw klkI Avqwrw ]bwjq qUr hoq Jnkwrw ]hwhw mwDo bwn kmwn kiRpwn sMBwry ]pYTy suBt hQXwr auGwry ]546]
transliteration: Jab Kopaa Kalkiavtaaraa|| Baajat Toor Hot Jhankaaraa|| Haahaa Maadho Baan Kamaan Kridaan Sanbhdare|| Paithe Soubhat Hathyaar Oughdare||546||
translation: When Lord Kalki became infuriated, then the war-horns sounded; and there was jingling sound; the Lord held up his bow and arrow and the sword and taking out his weapons, he penetrated amongst the warriors.546.

gurmukhi: lIn mcIn dys kw rwjw ]qw idn bjy JuJwaU bwjw ]hwhw mwDo dys dys ky CqR iCnwey ]dys bdys qurMg iPrwey ]547]
transliteration: Leen Macheen Des Kaa Raajaa|| Taa Din Bade Jhujhaaoo Baajaa|| Haahaa Maadho Des Des Ke Chhatra Chhinaae|| Des Bades Turan Phiraae||547||
translation: When the king of Manchuria was conquered, on that day, the war-drums sounded; the Lord, causing loud lamentation, snatched away the canopies of various countries and got his horse moved in all the countries.547.
